result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas G Ralston

records.addlTxt:
9:17 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Nicholas G Ralston appeared by Zoom video.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Nicholas G Ralston.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed in the document.  State confirms the offer noting that the defendant paid up-front restitution and completed community service to accept the offer.  Defense confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty. 

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Hughes.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $389.00;
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (20-as ordered by the Court as the defendant resides in IL) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 60 days.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas G Ralston
Current: Unknown,   (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: 5204 Pebble Lane, Lovers Park, IL 61111

addressed to: Nicholas G Ralston for hearing on October 27, 2022 
Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:37 AM Defendant Nicholas G Ralston in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Nicholas G Ralston.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Hughes provides an update and requests this be set for plea/sentencing.  No objection by the State. Atty Hughes requests the defendant appear by video for the plea and sentencing, no objection by the State. Court will allow the defendant to appear by zoom for the plea and sentencing hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Witness List filed.
Trial Order signed by Judge Paul F Reilly August 11, 2022.

Jury status hearing on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:02 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Nicholas G Ralston in court by Zoom video means with attorney Steven Hughes.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Reider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Hughes provides an update, he is asking the matter be set for trial.  Atty. Hughes believes it will be a 1-2 day trial.  Court will schedule the matter for jury status and jury trial date.  Court will prepare and sign a pretrial order.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Filed by Atty. Hughes requesting his client be allowed to appear by Zoom for the 8/5/22 status hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Lau 7/28/2022 - Request granted.**

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Steven Hughes
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:08 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Nicholas G Ralston in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews the case on the record and inquires if the defendant plans to proceed pro se.  Defendant advises he was going to retain private counsel but due to some medical issues he is not able to afford private counsel.  Court advises the defendant that if his financial circumstances have changed he can report to the Public Defender's office to see if he qualifies, if he does not he can then file a petition for appointment of counsel.  Court provides the defendant with the map to get to the Public Defender's office as well as a petition for appointment of counsel.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Matter was set for Hearing but not called on the record.  Defendant had appeared but advised he was sick.  Judge Lau approved sending the defendant home and clerk advises the defendant a new court date would be scheduled, and notice mailed.  Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Letter received via fax from defendant.
** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 5/25/2022 - If we can't read it, I can't comment. The defendant will have to resend this letter.**
Hearing on May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals/Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:36 AM Defendant Nicholas G Ralston in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Lau
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
